name: Trump Old Post Office
description: Prior to Donald Trump's official bid for the White House, the Trump Organization secured a 60-year lease with the U.S. government to renovate a historic post office in Washington, D.C., into a luxury, mixed-use development. The arrangement presents ongoing concerns now that Donald Trump is the U.S. government's chief executive. His position as both landlord and tenant opens opportunities for self-dealing that could prioritize his business interests over government efficiency. Additionally, foreign dignitaries and business representatives may book hotel stays and events as a means of currying favor with the president. A contractual clause designed to avoid such conflicts of interest prevents any elected official from sharing or benefiting from the lease. Because Trump did not divest of his business interest upon taking office, he may be violating the contract. However, his interests as either landlord and tenant would not be served by terminating the lease.

familyMemberEthics.description: Ivanka Trump served as Member, President, Treasurer of IVANKA OPO LLC from Jun 1, 2013, until Jan 1, 2017. Ivanka Trump lists Ivanka OPO LLC (Investment in Trump Old Post Office LLC; Washington, DC) as an employment-related asset valued at $5,000,001 - $25,000,000. In the year before taking her unpaid position as assistant to her father in his presidency, she earned $2,423,475 in Hotel-Related Revenue income. The work for which she earned compensation is described as "Development and management of hotel in Washington DC." Because there is no indication her interest in this entity has been divested or placed into a blind trust, it is marked in this database as an active potential conflict of interest.
